title: Strictly's Oti Mabuse displays her dancer's legs a tartan mini-skirt as she leaves It Takes Two
text:
She's enjoying a stint of Strictly Come Dancing success alongside her partner Kelvin Fletcher.

And show professional Oti Mabuse had plenty to smile about as she left the set of spin-off It Takes Two in London on Thursday evening.

The dancer, 29, flaunted her toned legs in a red tartan-mini skirt, which she teamed with a black leather shirt.

Checkmate: Strictly Come Dancing's Oti Mabuse had plenty to smile about as she left the set of spin-off It Takes Two in London on Thursday evening

Oti's wore her braided tresses tied back and she added to her look with a pair of raven ankle boots.

A dash of cherry red lipstick and hoop earrings completed the look, with the talented dancer also carrying a pastel pink overcoat on her arm.

Oti looked happy and relaxed as she left It Takes Two following her continuing success on Strictly with Kelvin, 35.

The former Emmerdale actor was also in good spirits as he left the spin-off show's set at the same time as Oti.

Leggy lady: The dancer, 29, flaunted her toned legs in a red tartan-mini skirt, which she teamed with a black leather shirt

Dressed to impress: Oti's wore her braided tresses tied back and she added to her look with a pair of raven ankle boots

The actor wore a simple sweater and jeans, which he paired with pristine white trainers.

Oti's appearance comes after she and Kelvin were hailed as the 'perfect match' when they scored a whopping 36 points out of 40 for their skilled Rumba ten days ago.

The former Emmerdale star and the ballroom professional narrowly missed out on the top spot behind Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden, who were awarded 38 points for their Tango routine during the fourth edition of the live shows.

Last week, the pair bagged second place as they performed a sexually charged Cha Cha Cha and were awarded a 33 from the judges.

Oti and Kelvin danced to Aston Merrygold's Get Stupid and following the performance Shirley told them: 'You definitely brought lots of sunshine! Cool, took it in your stride.

Accessories: A dash of cherry red lipstick and hoop earrings completed the look and the star also carried a pastel pink overcoat on her arm

A lot to smile about: The professional dancer was in high spirits following her continuing success on Strictly with her show partner Kelvin Fletcher, 35

'What I'd like to continue is a strong leg action for more fluidity, you're a great performer but I want you to start working on flow.'

Referencing Kelvin's killer hip action, Alfonso told him: 'It's great to be back, but it's better to see that!

'As a race car driver, there's a thing called driving fro mtge seat of your car, and the seat of your car had the ladies hot!'

Quick to put a damper on the complementary chat, Craig added: 'Thought you were a little bit stiff, it's what Shirley was suggesting but I get booed!

Mosti told them: 'You have such great foot speed, and there were so many rhythms of Cha Cha, you had everything in place!

What a pair: The former Emmerdale actor was also in good spirits as he left the spin-off show's set at the same time as Oti

'You kept the energy, you gave me flirty, you gave me oh-oh that's what I need for a Cha Cha!'

Following the routine Kelvin said: 'I was so nervous! I didn't know the steps as I was going into it.'

Also noting that his brother was watching from the audience, he said: 'He's my best mate I idolise him!'

Oti and Kelvin will perform the Tango to Bad Guy by Billie Eilish on Saturday night's show.
description: The Strictly Come Dancing professional, 29, had plenty to smile about as she left the set of spin-off It Takes Two in London on Thursday evening.
